description: 100 claims for Experiment 12 — Perplexity-Truth Correlation. Balanced across labels (TRUE/FALSE/CONTESTED/STALE) and domains (TECHNICAL/BUSINESS/SOCIAL/REGULATORY/GENERAL).

claims.text: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at standard atmospheric pressure.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: The Earth orbits the Sun once every 365.25 days.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: TCP uses a three-way handshake to establish connections.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: SHA-256 produces a 256-bit hash digest.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Amazon's revenue exceeded $500 billion in 2022.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: GDPR applies to all companies processing EU citizens' data, regardless of company location.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Photosynthesis converts carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: JavaScript is single-threaded with an event loop for concurrency.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: The human genome contains approximately 3 billion base pairs.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: SOC 2 Type II audits evaluate controls over a period of time, not just at a point in time.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Apple became the first company to reach a $3 trillion market capitalization.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: HTTP status code 404 indicates a resource was not found.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Insulin regulates blood glucose levels in the human body.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Git uses a directed acyclic graph to model commit history.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: HIPAA requires encryption of protected health information in transit.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: The S&P 500 index tracks 500 large-cap US companies.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: DNA has a double-helix structure.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Kubernetes orchestrates containerized applications across clusters.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: The Federal Reserve sets the federal funds rate target in the United States.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Microsoft acquired LinkedIn for $26.2 billion in 2016.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Transistors in modern CPUs are manufactured at nodes as small as 3 nanometers.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Gravity accelerates objects at approximately 9.8 meters per second squared on Earth's surface.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: The PCI DSS standard requires quarterly vulnerability scans.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: Berkshire Hathaway's Class A shares have never been split.
claims.label: TRUE

claims.text: The Great Wall of China is visible from the Moon with the naked eye.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Common myth — not visible from space

claims.text: Humans only use 10 percent of their brains.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Common myth — tall structures get struck repeatedly

claims.text: TCP/IP was invented by Tim Berners-Lee.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: TCP/IP was Cerf and Kahn; Berners-Lee invented the Web

claims.text: Python is a compiled language that produces native machine code.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: Facebook was founded in 2001 by Mark Zuckerberg and Steve Jobs.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: The EU AI Act classifies all machine learning systems as high-risk.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: Gold is the best conductor of electricity among all metals.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: SQL databases cannot handle more than one million rows.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: SQL databases handle billions of rows

claims.text: Tesla was the first company to mass-produce electric vehicles.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: GM EV1, Nissan Leaf, etc. preceded Tesla mass production

claims.text: GDPR only applies to companies headquartered in Europe.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Applies to any company processing EU data

claims.text: Antibiotics are effective against viral infections.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: REST APIs must always return JSON responses.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: The United States has always had a federal income tax since its founding.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: Google's IPO was the largest in technology history.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: Diamonds are the hardest known substance and cannot be destroyed.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Diamonds can burn; wurtzite boron nitride may be harder

claims.text: Blockchain technology requires proof-of-work consensus.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Many consensus mechanisms exist (PoS, PBFT, etc.)

claims.text: Warren Buffett founded Berkshire Hathaway as an investment firm.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Originally a textile company; Buffett took control in 1965

claims.text: Napoleon Bonaparte was unusually short for his era.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: He was average height (~5'7") — myth from French/English unit confusion

claims.text: All HTTP requests are encrypted by default.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Only HTTPS is encrypted; HTTP is plaintext

claims.text: SOX compliance is voluntary for publicly traded US companies.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: SOX is mandatory for public companies

claims.text: Uber has been consistently profitable since its IPO in 2019.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Uber posted losses for years after IPO

claims.text: Evolution is the process by which organisms improve over time.
claims.label: FALSE
claims.notes: Evolution is adaptation, not improvement — common misconception

claims.text: NoSQL databases are always faster than relational databases.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: The Basel III framework applies only to European banks.
claims.label: FALSE

claims.text: Large language models understand the meaning of the text they generate.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Active debate in AI philosophy — Chinese Room argument

claims.text: Remote work is more productive than in-office work.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Studies conflict; depends on role, measurement, culture

claims.text: Nuclear energy is the safest form of power generation per unit of energy produced.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Statistically low deaths/TWh but public perception and tail risks debated

claims.text: Cryptocurrency will eventually replace traditional fiat currencies.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Microservices architecture is superior to monolithic architecture.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Trade-offs depend on team size, complexity, scale

claims.text: Social media usage causes depression in teenagers.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Correlation established; causation debated (Haidt vs. critics)

claims.text: Universal basic income would reduce poverty without reducing workforce participation.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Agile development methodology produces higher quality software than waterfall.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Context-dependent; regulated industries often prefer waterfall

claims.text: China's GDP will surpass the United States by 2030.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Organic food is healthier than conventionally grown food.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Nutritional differences are minimal per most meta-analyses

claims.text: AI-generated art constitutes genuine artistic expression.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Open source software is more secure than proprietary software.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Immigration has a net positive economic impact on host countries.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Economic consensus leans positive but distributional effects debated

claims.text: The gig economy benefits workers by providing flexibility.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Venture capital funding is the best path for startup growth.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: VC vs. bootstrapping debate; depends on market and goals

claims.text: Artificial general intelligence will be achieved within the next decade.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Expert predictions range from 5 years to never

claims.text: Carbon offsets are an effective tool for combating climate change.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Standardized testing accurately measures student intelligence.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Measures preparation and socioeconomic factors as much as aptitude

claims.text: Rust will replace C++ as the dominant systems programming language.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Growing adoption but C++ inertia is massive

claims.text: Central bank digital currencies will improve financial inclusion.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Minimum wage increases reduce employment.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Card-Krueger vs. classical economics; evidence is mixed

claims.text: Electric vehicles have a lower total lifecycle carbon footprint than combustion vehicles.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Depends on grid mix, battery manufacturing, vehicle lifetime

claims.text: Regulation of tech companies stifles innovation.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Trade-off between consumer protection and innovation

claims.text: TypeScript's type system prevents most runtime errors.
claims.label: CONTESTED
claims.notes: Catches type errors but not logic errors; any/unknown escape hatches

claims.text: Billionaires create more jobs than government spending programs.
claims.label: CONTESTED

claims.text: Twitter has approximately 330 million monthly active users.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Pre-Musk figure; now X with different metrics and likely different numbers

claims.text: Moore's Law predicts transistor density doubling every two years.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: Interest rates in the United States are near zero.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Was true 2020-2022; rates rose sharply in 2022-2023

claims.text: Inflation in the United States is running at approximately 9 percent annually.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: True briefly in mid-2022; dropped significantly since

claims.text: The UK is a member of the European Union.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Was true until Brexit completed Jan 2020

claims.text: WeWork is valued at $47 billion.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: Heroku offers a free tier for hobby projects.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: Russia is the largest supplier of natural gas to Europe.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: True pre-2022; Europe has diversified since Ukraine invasion

claims.text: Silicon Valley Bank is one of the top 20 banks in the United States.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: FTX is a leading cryptocurrency exchange.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: The WHO classifies COVID-19 as a global pandemic.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: Global supply chain disruptions are causing widespread semiconductor shortages.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Peak shortage was 2021-2022; largely resolved by 2024

claims.text: CentOS is a free enterprise Linux distribution supported by Red Hat.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: CentOS shifted to CentOS Stream in 2020; no longer traditional rebuild

claims.text: The Paris Agreement commits nations to limiting warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Commitment exists but current trajectories exceed 1.5C; goal may be stale

claims.text: Zoom is primarily used as a video conferencing tool for remote work during the pandemic.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Usage normalized post-pandemic; no longer primarily pandemic-driven

claims.text: Docker is the dominant container runtime in Kubernetes.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Kubernetes deprecated dockershim in 1.20; containerd is now dominant

claims.text: Yahoo is one of the most valuable internet companies.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Was true in 2000s; long since eclipsed

claims.text: The Trans-Pacific Partnership is the largest trade agreement in history.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: US withdrew in 2017; became CPTPP without US

claims.text: LIBOR is the primary benchmark for global interest rates.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: LIBOR phased out; replaced by SOFR and other rates

claims.text: AngularJS is the most popular frontend JavaScript framework.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: Oil prices are negative.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: WTI went briefly negative in April 2020; not sustained

claims.text: The Privacy Shield framework governs EU-US data transfers.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Invalidated by Schrems II in 2020; replaced by EU-US Data Privacy Framework

claims.text: Clubhouse is the fastest-growing social media platform.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: NFTs are a billion-dollar market.
claims.label: STALE

claims.text: Solana processes 65,000 transactions per second.
claims.label: STALE
claims.notes: Theoretical maximum; real-world throughput much lower with frequent outages
